subject: Re: what is the order of Executon of Test Methods in a Test Class
msgSnippet: ... That should not be a concern.  The individual tests should be completely independant to avoid odd interactions and ripple errors. I always assume that
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, veera sekhar <sekharsv@y...> wrote:
> Hi all,
> what is the order of Executon of Test Methods in a
> Test Class?

That should not be a concern. The individual tests should be
completely independant to avoid odd interactions and "ripple" errors.

I always assume that the order is non-deterministic.

If a specific order is required (more often it is simply desired, not
required... you should make your tests independant.. it's always
possible) there is OrderedTestSuite that is part of the Gargoyle JUnit
extensions at http://gsbase.sourceforge.net/

Dave
